intro: Barombia schliebenii, commonly known as the Schlieben's barombia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in moist, shaded habitats within tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered critically endangered and is rarely seen in the wild.
